title: Service for Research and Documentation
text:
The Service for Research and Documentation (; abbr. SID) was the <a href="foreign%20intelligence%20agency">foreign intelligence agency</a> of <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>. It was under authority of <a href="Ministry%20of%20Foreign%20Affairs%20%28Serbia%29">Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Serbia</a>. The Service's responsibility was intelligence gathering and other security activities relating to terrorism. 
History.
The Service was established in 1947 in the former Yugoslavia.

The other two, the "Service for Research and Documentation" was planned to be dissolved and partly reorganized into Department for Analytic and Support (), and "Security Service of Foreign Ministry" was merged into the Department within Ministry responsible for technical security of Ministry buildings and officers.
On 14 September 2013, the Minister of Foreign Affairs <a href="Ivan%20Mrki%C4%87">Ivan Mrkić</a> has announced the restoring of the Service. Until now, that has not happened.
